alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 08 at 3:39AM MST until May 09 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR ALL OF NORTHERN ARIZONA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 8 PM MST MONDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN ARIZONA... The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a Red Flag Warning due to strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM to 8 PM MST Monday. * AFFECTED AREA...All of northern Arizona today and portions of northeastern Arizona on Monday. This includes portions of the Coconino National Forest, Kaibab National Forest and Prescott National Forest. * WINDS...Today, southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. Local gusts up to 60 mph downwind of high terrain features like the San Francisco Peaks and Black Mesa. On Monday, southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 8 to 12 percent. Humidity trending closer to 15 to 20 percent in the higher mountains above 7000 ft. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low humidity can cause fire to rapidly grow in size and intensity before first responders can contain them.
